content.description: This route looks deceivingly easy and nice from the start which is what lured us in.  It heads up a nice hand crack on low angle terrain to a steep chimney.  From there through a large bush/tree and up a hand crack.  From your last solid piece of gear climb what becomes steep dirt by digging your fingers in hard.  Crampons and an ice axe may bring the grade down a little.  An easy gulley leads to the top.
content.protection: Medium cams cover most of the route but bring some small and a #4 was used on our ascent.
content.location: Just right of Roshambo.  Hand crack that tends up and right on low angle terrain.

content.description: Obvious dihedral crack to the right of Rock Beats Death.  After the crack dwindles (15ft above the tree) move left for 4 bolts to bolted anchors.  A little chossy but will be fun after it's cleaned up a bit from use.
content.protection: Standard rack + 4 bolts to bolted anchors.

content.description:
2 fairly long pitches of crack climbing up the center of the Ramona wall.  From fingers to chimney and everyting in between.

P1(10a)  Up the steep wide hands crack to a chimney with small gear in the back.  After the chimney up and left to a comfy belay ledge at the base of the P2 dihedral.  Alternatively, traverse left before squeezing into the chimney to gain a hand crack which leads directly up to the same belay.

P2(9)  Clean but slippery finger crack in a right facing dihedral.  Near the top the route follows broken rock right around a roof.  Build a gear anchor or, only if nobody is below you, set a belay at the rap station ~40 feet out right.

Walk to climbers right ~40 feet to a rap station that is a rope stretcher with a 60 meter rope back to Roshambo ledge.  Be very careful at the end of this very long rappel.
content.location: Starts at the far left side of the Roshambo Ledge.  Short 4th class approach.  The lower pitch starts at the steep hand crack and the upper pitch is a clean right facing dihedral that can be seen from the ground.

content.description: Climb the left-facing overlap/crack just right of the bolted line for Rattlesnake Airline. Undercling/layback the overlap using positive, slabby feet forty feet or so to a "roof". After this, continue up four well-placed bolts (shared with Rattlesnake Airline) to the rap anchors.
content.protection: Takes nuts well and plenty small to finger size cams. Small selection .75-2 useful. Then  4 bolts. Extendable draws will reduce rope drag.
content.location: From Roshambo, go climber's right on the ledge about 30 feet--around the ramp. Starts to the right of and below bolted line, Rattlesnake Airline.

content.description: A nice cruise up a slab broken up by two small "headwalls" that require some thought.  This is a very popular route for sub-5.10 climbers.
content.protection: BE VERY CAREFUL RAPELLING OFF THIS ROUTE.  It is longer than half a 60 meter rope so you will end up rapelling off the end of your 60 just as you touch off on the ground.  TIE KNOTS FOR THE RAPPEL.  8 lead bolts.
content.location: Middle of Roshambo ledge.  The start scrambles up a short gulley, just left of a left facing dihedral hand crack (Rock Beats Death).

content.description: Balancy face climbing leads to an easier slab above.  A fun route that can be knocked off fairly quickly before rapping off the ledge.
content.location: Far right side of Roshambo Ledge.  Belay left of the bolted rap station 20 feet or so.  There is one more route to the right of this (Rock Beats Scissors).  That route takes some gear in addition to the bolts you see from the ground.
